data.title: Never lose your data
data.subtitle: You choose where to store your encrypted vault

zero_totp.title: Store your encrypted vault on Zero-TOTP's servers
zero_totp.desc: This is the default and mandatory option. Your encrypted vault is stored on our servers, hosted in France ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· and Canada ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦. Nobody has access to your data, except you. This option is the one used when your log in to your account on zero-totp.com. You cannot disable this option, but you can backup your vault on your computer or on your google drive.

google.title: Back up your encrypted vault in your google drive
google.desc:
You can synchronize your encrypted vault with your google drive. This option is not mandatory, but it is highly recommended. In case of a server crash, you will be able to recover your encrypted vault from your google drive.
Your vault is still encrypted and only your passphrase can decrypt it. This passphrase is never stored anywhere.

local.title: Back up your encrypted vault in your computer
local.desc:
You can download your encrypted vault and store it in your computer (or anywhere else). This option is not mandatory, but it is highly recommended. In case of a server crash, you will be able to recover your encrypted vault from your computer.
As always, your vault is still encrypted and only your passphrase can decrypt it. This passphrase is never stored anywhere.

backup.title: And always have a
backup.desc: You should always be able to access your TOTP code. That's why
backup.desc_strong: Zero-TOTP has 4 independant platform where you can decrypt your vault.

option.zero_totp: The complete version of Zero-TOTP, up to date with all its features.
option.rescue: A very simple, minimal and ULTRA stable frontend, hosted on github pages where you can upload a backup your vault and decrypt it. In case of zero-totp's servers failure, your backup vaults can still be opened
option.mobile: To retrieve all your codes directly in your pocket.
option.cli: To retrieve all your codes form your terminal (CLI unix only).

about.title: About Zero-Knowledge Encryption
about.zke_def: Zero Knowledge Encryption (ZKE) refers to a robust security measure that ensures the utmost protection of your data. With ZKE, your information is encrypted locally on your device before being uploaded to the cloud, and only you hold the encryption keys, guaranteeing that no one, including the service provider, can access your data without your explicit permission. This empowers you with complete control over your sensitive information while enjoying the convenience and flexibility of cloud storage.

desc.part1: Zero-TOTP was first launched in 2023 by
desc.part2: with the aim to provide a 100% open-source, safe and reliable alternative to proprietary totp clients. The project is still in development and is currently in beta.
